intro: Aiphanes chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. This plant typically grows as a solitary tree with a straight, unbranched stem and a crown of pinnate leaves. Its inflorescences are clustered at the base of the stem, producing both male and female flowers. The plant is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various organisms.
